pull_request.title: Create SRC rounds with keys and appropriate permissions

update.description:
When a round is created:

- a simulator instance and a field computer instance are launched

- ssh keys for these instances are created and permissions are set depending on the mode it's in (practice vs competition)

- server vpn keys are generated by posting to the keys server

- the cloudsim.options data will be populated with ssh key url and vpn config settings once all necessary info is available (after ~10seconds when simulator ip is available).

- the round data will be populated with ssh key and instance data
update.title: Create SRC rounds with keys and appropriate permissions

pullrequest.title: Create SRC rounds with keys and appropriate permissions

content.raw:
I checked and all that's available at `public` here are the machine resource ids:

~~~
{
  "simulator_id": "simulator-2090",
  "fieldcomputer_id": "simulator-2091"
}
~~~

I also checked that the competitor can't use these ids to get the simulators using the `GET /simulators/<id>` route. Not super important, but I think we could move those ids to the secure data.
content.html:
I checked and all that's available at public here are the machine resource ids:

{
  "simulator_id": "simulator-2090",
  "fieldcomputer_id": "simulator-2091"
}

I also checked that the competitor can't use these ids to get the simulators using the GET /simulators/<id> route. Not super important, but I think we could move those ids to the secure data.

content.html: I think this is fine, but just for some context, the idea of not allowing competitors to see permissions was so that they couldn't see admins emails. But yeah, I don't think it's important here.
